column2: Guided by the instructions written upon the card, the hunter had made all haste towards the rendezvous there given.
column3: Guided by the instructions written upon the card, the hunter had made all haste towards the rendezvous there given.

column2: He had arrived within sight, and fortunately within rifle-range of the spot, at that critical moment when the jaguar was preparing to spring.
column3: He had arrived within sight, and fortunately within rifle range of the spot, at that critical moment when the jaguar was preparing to spring.

column2: His bullet did not prevent the fierce brute from making the bound--the last of its life--though it had passed right through the animal's heart.
column3: His bullet did not prevent the fierce brute from making the bound-the last of its life-though it had passed right through the animal's heart.

column2: This was a thing thought of afterwards--there was no opportunity then.

column2: On rushing into the water, to make sure that his shot had proved fatal, the hunter was himself attacked; not by the claws of the jaguar, but the hands of the man just rescued from them.
column3: On rushing into the water, to make sure that his shot had proved fatal, the hunter was himself attacked; not by the claws of the jaguar, but the hands of the man just rescued from them.

column2: Fortunate for Zeb, that the mustanger's knife had been left upon land. As it was, he came near being throttled; and only after throwing aside his rifle, and employing all his strength, was he able to protect himself against the unlooked-for assault.
column3: Fortunate for Zeb, that the mustanger's knife had been left upon land. As it was, he came near being throttled; and only after throwing aside his rifle, and employing all his strength, was he able to protect himself against the unlooked for assault.

column2: The delirious man wrestled with his rescuer--not in silence, but with shouts and threatening speeches--his eyes all the time rolling and glaring with a fierce, demoniac light.

column3: Hats of Guayaquil grass-erroneously called Panama-were not uncommon. Scores of Southerners wore them, in Texas as elsewhere.
